result.execSummary:
The defendant Teresa Lynn Towne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Shall submit a DNA sample.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teresa Lynn Towne

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:50 PM.  Cases called 21CF289, 22CF185 and 22CF217.  Defendant Teresa Lynn Towne in court in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Teresa Lynn Towne.  Attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF217 Initial appearance - Waive reading, enter NG plea, court finds probable cause.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing with defendant.  Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  22CF185  - Review of info is waived; not guilty pleas entered.  22CF217 Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered.  Atty. Barrington heard on agreement.  Court reviews agreement and PQWOR with defendant.  22CF185 - DE pleads guilty to count 1.  Court finds factual basis, plea made FVI, accepts plea and finds guilty of count 1 in 22cf185, count 2 is DRI, 22cf217 count 1 is DRI.  Atty. Barrington is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Schoenfeldt heard.  Defendant makes statement.  Neither parties make corrections to the revocation packet.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

21CF289:
1 year DCJ with H&T.
72 days presentence credit.

22CF185:
Sentence withheld:
Probation 24 months, consecutive to 21cf289.
AODA and follow though,
absolute sobriety,
any counseling directed by agent.
Costs.
DNA Sample and surcharge.

Court reviews firearms and voting restrictions.

Adjustment Number: 22A 078766,
Payable Number: 243903,
Receipt Number: 22R 011439,
Amount: $20.00

8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teresa Lynn Towne in court, in custody. Discussion held. Court hands copy of PH notice and sets Review for next week.
Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not go on the premises at 301 Rosendale St, Beaver Dam WI.

12:52 PM Intern Marco Lewis w/Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teresa Lynn Towne appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (not eligible) appeared by video for Teresa Lynn Towne. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not possess any firearms. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not go on the premises at 301 Rosendale St, Beaver Dam WI.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
